title: Vikings, Game of Thrones, Superheroes, Wizards, Demons, Angels: Storytelling Religion
description:
Richard Rohlin's observation to Jonathan Pageau about the relationship between fantasy and the medieval world continued to stick in my mind. This has been haunting me while watching both Vikings and The Last Kingdom and the reason I liked one more than the other was articulated by Tom Holland and Dominic Sandbrook in their podcast 'The Rest is History". 

What exactly are we doing with these stories? How are we trying to weave our world together? How does the "spiritual" fit in? 

@Jonathan Pageau Universal history https://youtu.be/_N5s4n_lwB8
Netflix The Last Kingdom https://www.netflix.com/title/80074249
Vikings the History Channel https://www.history.com/shows/vikings
The Rest is History Game of Thrones https://pca.st/yiumjl8j
Game of Thrones HBO https://www.hbo.com/game-of-thrones
@Jonathan Pageau Montero https://youtu.be/q1-U5WSy2Gs
@Jordan B Peterson  Superheroes https://youtu.be/VXiLvPjeK1M
https://www.vox.com/22215076/bridgerton-race-racism-historical-accuracy-alternate-history
This Present Darkness https://amzn.to/3hKPjRw
